techmeme.title: A look at the legal dispute between Walgreens and Cooler Screens, which installed 10,000 smart doors that track shoppers and show ads at Walgreens' US stores (Austin Carr/Bloomberg)
Sources: RedNote staff is scrambling to hide US users' posts from Chinese users after China raised concerns about politically sensitive English-language posts (The Information)
Earnest Analytics: ~60% of paid Gemini users kept their subscriptions six months after signing up, better than Perplexity but lagging behind ChatGPT and Claude (Miles Kruppa/Wall Street Journal)
Letter: Google told EU it will not add fact checks to search results and YouTube videos or use them in ranking or removing content, despite new EU requirements (Sara Fischer/Axios)
US school districts hit by PowerSchool's December breach say hackers accessed "all" historical student and teacher data; PowerSchool has 50M+ US student records (Carly Page/TechCrunch)
